lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Represents a bot that will carry out different command with user input.
* and loads the content of the local file into storage.
* @param filePath path of the local path.
* Runs the bot by taking in user input,
* which is then parsed into commands and executed.
* Represents a command that adds a task to the task list.
* The given task-to-add may be a deadline, an event, or a to-do.
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Got it. I've added this duke.task:\n ";
* @param taskToAdd Task to be added to the task list.
* Executes the AddCommand by storing the task to the given task list.
* Writes the result to the local disk.
* @param tasks Task List that stores the task.
* @param ui Ui that shows message to the user.
* @param storage Storage in charge of writing to the local disk.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command generated from input of the user.
* @param tasks Task List that stores tasks.
* @param ui Ui that sends message to the user.
* @param storage Storage in charge of writing to the local disk.
* @throws DukeException If the method is invoked.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("This method is to be implemented by child classes.");
* Indicate whether the programme should continue running.
* It is to be overridden by subclasses of Command.
* Represents a command that deletes a task from the task list.
* It deletes the task based on the provided index of the task in the list.
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Noted. I've removed this duke.task:\n ";
* @param index Index of the task in the task list.
* Executes the command by deleting the task with given index in the task list.
* Writes the updated result to the local disk.
* Tells the user if the provided index is invalid.
* @param tasks Task List that stores tasks.
* @param ui Ui that sends message to the user.
* @param storage Storage in charge of writing to the local disk.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showError("☹ Please enter an index in the range!");
* Represents a command that stops the programme.
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "See you soon!";
* Execute the command by ending the programme.
* @param tasks Task List that stores tasks.
* @param ui Ui that sends message to the user.
* @param storage Storage in charge of writing to the local disk.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command that finds tasks
* whose description contains the given keyword.
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:";
* Constructs a new FindCommand instance with the given keyword.
* Executes the command by listing all tasks
* whose description contains the given keyword.
* @param tasks Task list that stores existing tasks.
* @param ui Ui that shows message to the user.
* @param storage Storage that writes to the local disk.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command that list all tasks in the task list.
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
* Executes the command by showing the users of the tasks stored in the task list.
* @param tasks Task List that stores tasks.
* @param ui Ui that sends message to the user.
* @param storage Storage in charge of writing to the local disk.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command that marks the given task as done.
* It marks the task based on the provided index of the task in the task list.
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Nice! I've marked this duke.task as done:\n ";
* @param index Index of the task in the task list.
* Executes the command by marking the task with the given index
* stored in the task list as done.
* Tells the user if the provided index is invalid.
* @param tasks Task List that stores tasks.
* @param ui Ui that sends message to the user.
* @param storage Storage in charge of writing to the local disk.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showError("☹ Please enter an index in the range!");
* Represents a command that indicates a task as not done yet.
* It unmarks the task based on the provided index of the task in the task list.
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "OK, I've marked this duke.task as not done yet:\n ";
* @param index Index of the task in the task list.
* Executes the command by indicating the task with the given index
* stored in the task list as not done yet.
* Tells the user if the provided index is invalid.
* @param tasks Task List that stores tasks.
* @param ui Ui that sends message to the user.
* @param storage Storage in charge of writing to the local disk.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showError("☹ Please enter an index in the range!");
* Represents a type of exception that is associated with duke.
* Constructs a DukeException instance with no parameter.
* Constructs a DukeException instance with an error message as String.
* Represents a parser that interprets the user input and
* turns the input into a command understood by duke.
private static final List<String> formatStrings = Arrays.asList(
* Parses the given user input and returns a command.
* If the user input cannot be recognised as a valid command,
* @throws DukeException If the user input is not a valid command.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Process the task to be added and specifies which type of Task it is,
* It throws a DukeException if the description of the task is null.
* @throws DukeException If the description of a task is empty.
public static Command prepareAdd(String commandWord, String description) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ Description of a duke.task cannot be empty!");
* Parses an input that potentially includes a date,
* It throws a DukeException when the input does not contain the required keyword.
* @throws DukeException If the required keyword (e.g. "/by" or "/at") is missing.
public static Command parseDate(String commandWord, String description) throws DukeException {
"☹ Please follow the format <deadline description /by date>");
"☹ Please follow the format <event description /at date>");
* Parses the given date using preset formats
* If the given date does not fulfil one of the preset formats,
* @throws DukeException If the given date string is not in one of the preset formats.
public static LocalDate parseDateFormats(String dateString) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ Invalid date format!");
* Parses an input that potentially includes an index.
* Returns a command that is either a DeleteCommand, MarkCommand, or UnmarkCommand.
* @throws DukeException If the given index is invalid.
public static Command parseIndex(String commandWord, String description) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ Please enter an index of a task!");
* Represents a storage place that deals with loading tasks
* from the file and saving tasks in the file.
* Constructs a Storage instance with a specified file path.
* @param filePath File path in local disk.
* Appends the given text to the file.
* @param ui Ui that shows message to the user.
public void appendToFile(String textToAppend, Ui ui) {
* Overwrites the file with content stored in the task list.
* @param tasks Task list whose content is used in overriding.
* @param ui Ui that shows message to the user.
public void overwriteFile(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
* Loads content of the specified file in the local disk into an ArrayList,
* and returns the ArrayList with parsed tasks inside.
* @return ArrayList that contains tasks stored in the local file.
* @throws DukeException If the specified file is not found in loca ldisk.
* Interprets the information stored in the local file.
* Converts the information into a task.
* @param str A line in the local file.
* @throws DukeException If information in the local file cannot be understood.
public Task fileInterpreter(String str) throws DukeException {
* Represents a list that contains different tasks.
* Constructs a new TaskList instance with no parameter.
* Constructs a new TaskList instance with a given List.
* Goes through all tasks stored in the list.
* Returns the total number of tasks in the list as String.
return "Now you have " + this.count + " tasks in the list.";
* Finds the task in the list given an index.
* @param index Position of the task in the list.
* Adds a task to the list.
* Delete a task from the list.
* Returns a new TaskList that stores tasks
* Represents a deadline which is ane type of task.
* Constructs a new Deadline instance with a description and a date.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* Represents an event which is one type of task.
* Constructs a new Event instance with a description and a date.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* Constructs a Task instance with a description.
* Returns "X" if the task is done,
* " " if the task is not done yet.
* Marks the task as not done yet.
* Returns true if the description of the task contains the keyword.
* Returns false if the description of the task does not contain the keyword.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* Represents a task to be conducted which is one type of task.
* Constructs a new ToDo instance with a description.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* Represents a tool that deals with interactions with the user.
* Shows the welcome message when duke is initiated.
System.out.println("Just a moment...\nHello! I am Duke.");
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Shows the message of loading error to the user.
System.out.println("Unable to read the specified file.");
* Reads and stores the user input.
* Shows the error message to the user.
* Shows the divider line to the user.
* Shows the message to the user when a command is executed successfully.
Task task = new Event("project meeting", LocalDate.parse("2022-11-02"));
assertEquals("[ ] watch tv", new Task("watch tv").toString());
assertEquals("[T][ ] write essay", new ToDo("write essay").toString());
# create bin directory if it doesn't exist
# compile the code into the bin folder, terminates if error occurred
# run the program, feed duke.commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
# compare the output to the expected output
